page.title: 03NATIONAL TRUST FAUNA
page.content: There are a variety of butterflies and moths to be found on Blackdown and Marley Common. Brimstone butterflies can be found in woodland glades. Also to be seen are Orange Tips and Tortoiseshells.The pine trees attract moths such as the Emperors and Eggars. There are several species of birds living on Blackdown. The most common are various kinds of tits and many Goldcrests and Redpolls.Some arrive in Spring and Summer like Siskins, Willow Warblers and Chiffchaff. Where there are plenty of Beech trees you can find the Wood-warbler and Tree pipits, Red-starts, and Crossbills. Some heathland birds like the Linnet and Yellowhammer nest in the gorse and small flocks of Meadow Pipits can be found in Autumn. Stonechats, Nightjars and Buzzards are sometimes seen.
